title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: package aims demonstrate water management alternatives means simple mass balance model. Currently, following state variables inputs considered:

title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: Volume mixed layer (VEV_E), epilimnion summer, total volume otherwise) Volume hypolimnion (VHV_H)

title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: dVEdt=Qin,E−Qout,E−Qout,wb,EdVHdt=Qin,H−Qout,H−Qout,wb,H\begin{align*} \frac{dV_E}{dt} &= Q_{, E} - Q_{, E} - Q_{, wb, E} \\ \frac{dV_H}{dt} &= Q_{, H} - Q_{, H} - Q_{, wb, H} \end{align*} : dVE=dVE+dVH|VH=0 dV_E = dV_E + dV_H \qquad | \qquad V_H = 0 start time summer stratification tstratt_{strat} can set user. time point, total volume VV subdivided epilimnetic volume VE=V⋅fepiV_E = V \cdot f_{epi} hypolimnetic part VH=V⋅(1−fepi)V_H = V \cdot (1- f_{epi}). end summer stratification occurs hypolimnion exhausted (VH=0V_H = 0) time exceeds fixed threshold ($t_{autumn$), mimicking thermal convection. simple approach intentionally chosen, even full hydrophysical 1D model also available.

title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: Considered water inflow (inflow), outflow (outflow) wild bed outlet (environmental outflow, outflow_wb). water inflow can entrain epilimnion hypolimnion. hypolimnion exist, hypolimnetic inflows added epilimnion.

title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: Water inflow abstraction can controlled pre-defined scenarios, currently following: standard: epilimnetic inflow, hypolimnetic outflows cold_inflow: hypolimnetic inflow outflows wb_top: epilimnetic inflow, hypolimnetic drinking water abstraction, environmental (“wild bed”) outflow taken epilimnion important settings vol, initial volume reservoir t_strat time stratification onset. parameter t_autumn specifies latest end date stratificatiion thermal convection, stratification can also occur earlier hypolimnion volume exhausted.

what: Series 1: realistic time series with balanced inflow and outflow
title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: first example shows standard example discharge_normal example data set provided package.  first attempt, assume inflow rather cold, entrains hypolimnion. outflows also abstracted bottom.  given data example, inflow outflow data well balanced, hypolimnion remains approximately constant level. course approximation, ignoring hydrophysical processes. Moreover, cold hypolimnetic inflow rarely observed nature. cases, inflowing water entrains epi- metalimnion. metalimnion considered simplicity, assume entrainment mixed layer.  see hypolimnion exhausted year. next example shows happens environmental (“wild bed”) outflow abstracted epilimnion:  see hypolimnetic volume can saved, .e. volume available volume drinking water abstraction. also positive effects water quality.
code: library("outfloweR") data("discharge_normal") plot_flows(discharge_normal,             xlab = "Day of the Year",            ylab_inflow = "Inflow (m3/d)",            ylab_outflow = "Raw water (m3/d)",            ylab_wildbed = "Env. Out (m3/d)") out <- scenario("cold_inflow", vol=60, t_strat=90, t_autumn=300,                 discharge_normal$inflow, discharge_normal$outflow,                 discharge_normal$outflow_wb)  plot_volumes(out,              xlab = "day of the year",              ylab = "Volume (Mio m3)",              legend_title = "Layer") out <- scenario("standard", vol=60, t_strat=90, t_autumn=300,                 discharge_normal$inflow, discharge_normal$outflow,                 discharge_normal$outflow_wb)  plot_volumes(out,              xlab = "day of the year",              ylab = "Volume (Mio m3)",              legend_title = "Layer") out <- scenario("wb_top", vol=60, t_strat=90, t_autumn=300,                 discharge_normal$inflow, discharge_normal$outflow,                 discharge_normal$outflow_wb)  plot_volumes(out)

what: Example 2: Simplified time series with a summer flood
title: Reservoir Mass Balance Simulation with Package `outfloweR`
text: create artifical inflow outflow time series, assume constant inflows outflows, plus summer flood event generated log-lormal function. leads increased total volume, subsequently removed dam. data creation somewhat technical given full reproducibility. may integrated example data set package later time.  Now let’s compare mass balance model scnearios standard (hypolimnetic wild bed) wb_top (wild bed abstraction epilimnion):  result, can clearly see loss hypolimnetic volume standard scenario shorter stratification period (top figure) extra hypolimnion volume gained second scenario, wild bed outled taken epilimnetic layer.
code: library("dplyr") const_discharge <- data.frame(   time = 1:365,   inflow = 0.2,   outflow=0.1,   outflow_wb=0.12 ) time <- 1:365; wave_start <- 150; yscale <- 10 wave <- yscale * dlnorm(time - wave_start, meanlog=2, sdlog=1)  summer_flood <- const_discharge |>   mutate(inflow = inflow + wave,          outflow_wb = ifelse(wave_start + 20 < time & time <= wave_start + 40, outflow + sum(wave)/20, outflow))  plot_flows(summer_flood,            xlab = "Day of the Year",            ylab_inflow = "Inflow (m3/d)",            ylab_outflow = "Raw water (m3/d)",            ylab_wildbed = "Env. Out (m3/d)") library("ggpubr") out1 <- with(summer_flood,             scenario("standard", vol=60, t_strat=90, t_autumn=300,               inflow, outflow, outflow_wb))  out2 <-  with(summer_flood,               scenario("wb_top", vol=60, t_strat=90, t_autumn=300,                        inflow, outflow, outflow_wb)) fig1 <- plot_volumes(out1, xlab = "day of the year", ylab = "Volume (Mio m3)", legend_title = "Layer") fig2 <- plot_volumes(out2, xlab = "day of the year", ylab = "Volume (Mio m3)", legend_title = "Layer") ggpubr::ggarrange(fig1, fig2, ncol=2)

what: Volume balance simulation of lakes and reservoirs
title: Simulation of Reservoir Mass Balance
text: R package calculates volume balances mono- dimictic lakes reservoirs temperate climate zone using simple volume balances. contains also functions deal bathymeric (alias hypsographic) functions shiny app demonstration purposes. tool intended demonstrate basic principles, whereas real cases hydrodynamic model may used, e.g.  aemon-j/LakeEnsemblR.

title: Simulation of Reservoir Mass Balance
code: remotes::install_github("tpetzoldt/outfloweR")

text: Sachse, R., Petzoldt, T., Blumstock, M., Moreira, S., Pätzig, M.,   Rücker, J., Janse, J. H., Mooij, W. M., Hilt, S. (2014).   Extending one-dimensional models deep lakes simulate impact   submerged macrophytes water quality.   Environmental Modelling Software, 61, 410-423 Hrbácek, J. (1966). morphometrical study backwaters fish ponds   relation representative plankton samples (appendix   C. 0. Junge depth distribution quadric surfaces   configurations). Hydrobiological Studies, 1, 221–257.

title: Hypsographic Table of a Conic Lake — hypso_cone
code: zmax   <- 20                            # maximum depth (m) area   <- function(Amax, zmax, z){Amax * (1 - (z)/zmax)^2} volume <- function(Amax, zmax, z){Amax * zmax/3 * (1 - z/zmax)^3} Amax   <- 12.07 * 1000 * 1000           # total Area (m^2) depth  <- seq(zmax, 0, -.1)             # depth (m)  hypso_cone <- data.frame(depth = depth,   volume = volume(Amax, zmax, depth),   area=area(Amax, zmax, depth) )  ## inverted  depth order hypso_cone$level <- zmax - hypso_cone$depth

what: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
title: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
text: main function creates function list object data table allow interpolation depths, areas volume fractions layers.

title: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
code: hypso_functions(table)

title: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
text: table hypsographic table (bathymetry) given data frame columns level, area volume

title: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
text: list functions following elements (slots): level(volume) interpolates level volume volume(level) interpolates volume given water level area(level) interpolates area given level vh(level, zmixreal) calculates hypolimnic volume surface water level (m ground) mixing depth (zmixreal, thermocline m surface) ve(level, zmixreal) calculates epilimnic volume surface water level zmixreal zmix(level, zmixreal) calculates average mixing depth (zmix) surface water level zmixreal zhm(level, zmixreal) calculates average depth bottom layer (hypolimnion metalimnion) sediment_area(level) calculates sediment area series water levels, level shoudl vecor water levels ascending order pelagic_ratio(level) calculates area ratio pelagic part (water) total area layers. equal 1 - sediment area fraction.

title: Hypsographic Functions from Tabular Interpolation — hypso_functions
code: data(hypso_bautzen)                      # load data table hypso <- hypso_functions(hypso_bautzen)  # create function object  hypso$volume(166)                        # volume at 166 m a.s.l. #> [1] 29463587 hypso$sediment_area(c(160, 166))         # sediment area of hypo- and epilimnion #> [1] 2722336 1914372
